snippet: Myanmar’s state-run newspaper expressed concerns that the “hard-won trust” between President Thein Sein and Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the Nobel laureate and opposition leader, could “vanish.”
abstract: State-run newspaper in Myanmar criticizes opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi for discouraging foreign investment in Myanmar during recent trip to Thailand; article is the latest suggestion that Aung San Suu Kyi's trip has strained her relationship with Pres Thein Sein and that hard-won trust between the two, considered essential for the country's drive toward democracy, could vanish.
lead_paragraph: Myanmar’s state-run newspaper expressed concerns that the “hard-won trust” between President Thein Sein and Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the Nobel laureate and opposition leader, could “vanish.”

headline.seo: Article Hints at Rift Between Top Figures in Myanmar
headline.main: Myanmar Article Hints at Strains Between Top Figures
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Article Hints at Strains Between Top Figures
